page.title: 02POPULATION IN TREVELMOND
page.content: TREVELMOND IS A SMALL VILLAGE WITH 30 TO 40 DWELLINGS. THERE ARE ABOUT 5 HOUSES UNDER CONSTRUCTION BUT NO LARGE SCALE DEVELOPMENT IS PLANNED. MANY OF THE HUNDRED OR SO OCCUPANTS HAVE ALWAYS LIVED IN THE AREA, IF NOT ON TREVELMOND. SOME HOWEVER ARE NOT CORNISH. THE AGE STRUCTURE OF THE POPULATION IS BIASSED TOWARDS THE ELDERLY, BECAUSE OF THE NEED TO MOVE TO FIND WORK. SOME YOUNGER PEOPLE HAVE MOVED IN BECAUSE THEY CAN COMMUTE TO PLYMOUTH OR ST.AUSTELL, BUT MANY OF THE YOUNG LEAVE TO GO TO COLLEGE OR TO FIND WORK.THERE IS NO VILLAGE SCHOOL. THERE IS A METHODIST SUNDAY SCHOOL, BUT NO PLAYGROUP OR MOTHER AND TODDLER GROUP.THERE IS ALSO NO BUS SERVICE.
